entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT TUESDAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:56PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CAUTION REGARDING HIGH WATER ON THE MENDENHALL RIVER... Heavy rain over the past 48 hours alongside periodic rain showers through the day has caused the Mendenhall River to rise to bankful conditions, with the water level having continued to rise through the evening hours. Some debris from falling trees has been reported moving down river.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 07 at 1:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Small streams draining the Talkeetna Mountains including Willow Creek, Little Susitna River and other small rivers.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 07 at 1:33PM AKDT until August 09 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Near passes in the Eastern Alaska Range. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 AM AKDT Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf through Monday Night at Shishmaref... North to northwest winds 10 to 20 mph with increasing Monday morning to north at 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf developing west of Cape Espenberg. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:24PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf through Monday night... West to northwest winds 15 to 25 mph will be increasing tonight to 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf developing through the evening and continuing into Monday night before winds diminish. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Brooks Range... Snow levels in the Brooks Range will be falling to around 2000 feet by Monday evening with up to 4 inches of accumulation expected by Tuesday morning. Temperatures will also be falling with the low temperatures in the passes falling to the uppers 20s.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool and Wet Into Mid Week... The cool and wet pattern will persist through mid week with snow levels falling to around 2000 ft by Monday night. Snow is expected in the Alaska Range with snowfall amounts of 6 to 8 inches possible in Denali Park, and the Eastern Alaska Range. Winds will be increasing near the Alaska Range passes with south
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Thunderstorms Return with Heavy Rain Risk... * Another surge of monsoon moisture will yield increased thunderstorm chances through Wednesday, with potential for heavy rainfall, flash flooding, and strong outflow winds. * Monday and Tuesday there is a 25 to 50 percent chance of any one point seeing a storm. Wednesday will see chances lower as drier
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Tacoma Area, Bellevue and Vicinity, East Puget Sound Lowlands, Lower Chehalis Valley Area, Hood Canal Area,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bellevue and Vicinity; Bremerton and Vicinity; East Puget Sound Lowlands; Hood Canal Area; Lower Chehalis Valley Area; Seattle and Vicinity; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area

entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT MONDAY BELOW 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Hot conditions with temperatures in the mid 80s to mid 90s expected. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 07 at 2:16PM PDT until August 08 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures 98 to 100. Low temperatures 65 to 68. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area, Upper Hood River Valley, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area, Western Columbia River Gorge and Central Columbia River Gorge.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Greater Vancouver Area; Western Columbia River Gorge

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 08 at 3:56AM CDT until August 09 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Shower and thunderstorm activity is ongoing as a surface low and frontal boundary both push through the area. Heavy rainfall rates may occur on already saturated ground, causing localized flash flooding, especially over southwestern Wisconsin, where heavier totals occurred last night. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON...
entry.cap:areaDesc: Fond Du Lac; Green Lake; Marquette

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 08 at 3:39AM CDT until August 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 4 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 08 at 3:26AM CDT until August 09 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High waves and strong currents are expected as waves build to 4 to 7 ft. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties. * WHEN...Through this evening.
